adjectives.description: shelfy (comparative more shelfy, superlative most shelfy)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Abounding in shelves; full of dangerous shallows.
examples: And, o'er the dang'rous deep, secure the navy flies; / Glides by the Sirens' cliffs, a shelfy coast, / Long infamous for ships and sailors lost
The tillable fields are in some places  […]  so shelfy that the corn hath much ado to fasten his root.
